title: Leaving Certificate Project Maths - Ordinary Level
headline: This free online maths course covers the Irish Junior Certificate (Ordinary Level) Project Maths Syllabus.
description: Are you looking to review various maths topics, or are you preparing for your leaving certification exam? This comprehensive video-based course includes content from the Irish Leaving Certificate Project Maths (Ordinary Level) Syllabus. Follow maths experts as they take you through step-by-step sample exam questions. Review Probability and Statistics while also covering Trigonometry, Functions, Algebra and Calculus, all in one location!
courseDescription:
This course is for students interested in studying the Project Maths Ordinary Level Course for the Irish Leaving Certificate or just furthering their knowledge and skill in Mathematics. This course provides students with videos on all the Ordinary Level topics in one location listed by module and topic.

The course starts off with teaching the learner about calculating probability and working out the statistics of different math problems/questions. Then it goes into the shape, size, length of sides, angles and relative position of figures/objects with geometry and trigonometry. Along with teaching the learner about arithmetic or financial maths, so you can workout your PRSI, net profit, take home pay and more. The first section then finishes off by teaching you about calculating the length, area and volume of different objects.

The second section starts off with introducing you to algebra and what it is, teaching you about processes need to work out algebraic equations. Next you will learn about solving various different types of algebraic equations working with inequalities. After which you will learn about manipulating complex numbers, the meaning of i and imaginary numbers. In the functions module you will learn about how to solve functions and plot them on graphs. The last module will teach you about working out the differentiation, and the second derivative, along with rules and important formulas for calculus.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital : a downloadable in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • : a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked , posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed : a physical version of your officially branded and security marked in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.

All are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison , please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison , you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our pricing, please visit our Pricing Page
